repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: President of the Seamen's Friend Society of Wilmington, N.C. Chiefly financial records and other papers of the Seamen's Friend Society, with a few items relating to charitable contributions around 1918. Several items also concern the United Laymen's Association of Wilmington.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Walter P. Sprunt Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Walter P. Sprunt Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 1975.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 10-4-75
This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Walter P. Sprunt was the president of the Seamen's Friend Society of Wilmington, N.C.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Chiefly financial records and other papers of the Seamen's Friend Society, with a few items relating to charitable contributions around 1918. Several items also concern the United Laymen's Association of Wilmington.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.
controlaccess.subject: Sailors -- Missions and charities -- United States
Charities -- Economic aspects -- North Carolina

scopecontent.p: Box 1 includes leases and other legal documents for various properties. Box 2 chiefly consists of Seaman's Friend Society vouchers and a YMCA file.
